intro: Exohebea dodii, commonly known as the mountain hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple or blue, typically blooming in spring. Exohebea dodii is well adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
